alert.note: Alert for Salt River and Wyoming Ranges; Teton and Gros Ventre Mountains; Wind River Mountains East; Wind River Mountains West; Yellowstone National Park (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued March 08 at 12:49PM MST until March 11 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH LATE FRIDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible with total snow accumulations of 10 to 20 inches. Winds could gust 20 to 35 mph, with gusts 40 to 50 mph possible on exposed ridges. * WHERE...Yellowstone National Park, Teton and Gros Ventre Mountains, Wind River Mountains West, Wind River Mountains East and Salt River and Wyoming Ranges. * WHEN...From late Thursday night through late Friday night. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult, especially during the Friday morning and evening commutes. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Local snow totals of around two feet possible in the Teton Range. Snowfall around Mammoth and through the Lamar Valley in Yellowstone National Park will generally be less than six inches.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
